source:
chelsea are in early discussions over a possible partnership with belgian club royal mouscron-peruwelz .
mouscron , in belgium 's pro league , had a partnership with lille but the french side are now poised to link up with another belgian club , ostend , leaving room for a new deal and chelsea are the preferred option .
the belgian club have been in the top flight for a season since winning promotion via the play-offs last summer .
they are 13th in the table , two points above the relegation places .
chelsea are in early discussions over a possible partnership with belgian club royal mouscron-peruwelz
mouscron had a partnership with lille but that is now set to end meaning there is to be room for chelsea
mouscron are currently 21th in belgium 's pro league , with players including tristan dingome ( left )
chelsea already have an agreement with vitesse arnhem in holland and have been looking at other link-ups across europe to help develop their squad .
vitesse currently have chelsea 's josh mceachran , bertrand traore and wallace on their books as they look to seek europa league qualification from the dutch eredivisie .
midfielder nemanja matic is the only current regular first-team player in jose mourinho 's squad to have spent time on loan with the dutch club .
bertrand traore is one of three players currently on loan at vitesse arnhem from chelsea this season
blues midfielder nemanja matic spent time on loan at vitesse before moving to benfica and then back
summary: Chelsea are in early discussions for a potential partnership with Belgian club Royal Mouscron-Peruwelz. This opportunity arises due to Mouscron's previous partnership with Lille ending, as Lille is now set to partner with another Belgian club, Ostend. Mouscron, currently 13th in the Belgian Pro League, had a player named Tristan Dingome on their roster. Chelsea already have an agreement with Vitesse Arnhem in the Netherlands, where they have loaned out players Josh McEachran, Bertrand Traore, and Wallace. Bertrand Traore is one of three players currently on loan at Vitesse from Chelsea this season. Nemanja Matic, a midfielder in Jose Mourinho's Chelsea squad, spent time on loan at Vitesse before moving to Benfica and then back to Chelsea.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the core information in the passage:

Chelsea is in early talks for a partnership with Belgian club Royal Mouscron-Peruwelz. Mouscron, currently in Belgium's Pro League, previously had a partnership with Lille, but this is ending as Lille is partnering with another Belgian club, Ostend. Mouscron is in 13th place in the league, just above relegation. Chelsea already has a partnership with Dutch club Vitesse Arnhem, where they send players on loan to develop. Currently, Josh McEachran, Bertrand Traore, and Wallace are on loan there from Chelsea. Nemanja Matic, now a regular in Chelsea's first team, previously spent time on loan at Vitesse. Chelsea is exploring similar partnerships across Europe to help develop their squad.

summary: Chelsea are exploring a potential partnership with Belgian club Royal Mouscron-Peruwelz, who recently ended their affiliation with French side Lille. Mouscron, currently 13th in the Belgian Pro League, are seeking a new partner to aid in their development. Chelsea already have a similar arrangement with Vitesse Arnhem in Holland, where they loan out players like Josh McEachran, Bertrand Traore, and Wallace. This strategy allows Chelsea to provide competitive playing time for their prospects while also potentially bolstering their first team with experienced players from these partnerships.
